body.p: To create a CEP Project, open WSO2 Developer Studio Dashboard and select CEP Project from Complex Event Processing Server category.
There are two ways to create a CEP Project

With the New CEP Project option, you will get an empty CEP Project according to the information that you have provided. At the same time, you can upload a CEP Configuration File with the extension of .xml from the file system.
If you select New CEP Project option, and click Next, wizard page will ask you general information like Project Name Give necessary information and click Next.
In the next page, you will see maven project options and click Finish
Now you will be directed to CEP Editor which consists of Design view and Source view
In the Design View you can give CEP bucket details and from a drop down box you can select the CEP Engine
In the Engine Configuration Properties you can add Siddhi Engine Parameters as name value pairs from the Dialog and finally click OK button to add properties to bucket.

You can add Input Configuration by clicking Add... button under the Inputs section and it will display the Input Configuration Dialog . Provide the relevent details and finally click OK button to add the Input to the Bucket

You can add queries by clicking Add... Button in the Queries section and it will display Query Configuration dialog and there you can give relevent details for the query and output and click OK button to add the query configuration to the bucket.
After that you can view the source by clicking Source tab in the CEP Editor
You can export the generated bucket.xml as a CAR File using Carbon Application Project
Note: If the generated xml file shows Query Event Type as Map make it as what ever type you want by editing the xml file in the CEP Editor.Siddhi only uses Tuple and for Siddhi make it Tuple.
